article: An inspirational young man who wasn't expected to survive a climbing accident is fighting his way back to fitness and raising cash for those who saved his life. But despite fears that he might never walk again, Callum, now 20, has _ everybody wrong with his amazing recovery. Not only is he walking, but he has just _ a 5-mile run in 50 minutes to raise money for the Great North Air Ambulance. Callum, who had to re-learn _ , has come a very long way from the day he nearly died from the accident. Back then, his parents were living every moment with the fear they might _ him. Mum Jan said: "He wasn't expected to survive _ his injuries were so severe. There were five surgeons _ to repair his artery . They had great _ in stopping the bleeding." He was just like a newborn baby again. He had to be _ how to sit up and walk." Callum admits that having to learn things again has been _ . He jokes that he is like "the Iron Man", _ the scars on his right arm. His story has _ a local businessman, who donated PS500 to Callum. With this generous donation, Callum has now _ more than PS1,800 for the air ambulance. "It's _ to be able to raise money for them for what I owe them," he said. "I owe so many people so much.
